results.title: No apple for Johnny
results.creator_credit: John Weldon, Robert Verrall, Dorothy Courtois, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This documentary cartoon is the visual enactment of the year-long obstacle course run by a teacher trainee. Rich in humour and anecdote, it is a comedy of educational manners seen through the autobiographical eye of a trainee-turned-filmmaker.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Weldon, Robert Verrall, Dorothy Courtois, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: No alternative
results.creator_credit: Tara Fitzpatrick, MTV and Red Hot Organisation
results.brief_description: No Alternative is a collaboration between independent filmmakers and musicians dedicated to raising awareness of issues affecting people living with HIV and AIDS. The video combines live performances, poetry readings and experimental short films. Some highlights include Hal Hartley’s evocative video for The Breeder’s song “Iris”; Tamara Davis’ documentary on the Riot Girls music scene (featuring Courtney Love, Kim Gordon and Huggy Bear); Lou Reed reading his poem “Busload of Faith”; Jennie Livingston’s tribute to lesbian comedy (with music by the Smashing Pumpkins); and Derek Jarman’s poetic super-8 short film based on Patti Smith’s memorial to Robert Mapplethorpe. Music is provided by The Breeders, Smashing Pumpkins, Neneh Cherry, Urge Overkill, Suede, Buffalo Tom and an uncredited Nirvana. This exceptional video manages to be challenging, musically innovative, and informative.

results.title: Nirvana Street murder
results.creator_credit: Aleksi Vellis, Fiona Cochrane, Cochrane Productions and Vellis
results.brief_description: This film tells the story of two brothers. One brother is a law abiding citizen who looks after a wealthy bedridden old lady in his spare time and tries desperately to win over the Greek immigrant parents of his girlfriend. The other is a likeable but dangerously off-the-wall criminal type who is sheltered by his ditzy pregnant girlfriend. A confrontation with the police and their Greek counterparts tears everything apart. The clash of cultures and turfs is a strong element in the story, which generally roars along with a mixture of comedy, violence and drama. Stars Ben Mendelsohn, Mark Little, Mary Coustas and the late Sheila Florance.

results.title: Ninotchka
results.brief_description: The ads proclaimed “Garbo laughs!” and back in that banner movie year of 1939, moviegoers everywhere joined in the laughter as the legendary actress starred in her first romantic comedy, “Ninotchka”. Garbo plays a dour, severe Soviet official who comes to Paris on business involving the the sale of some Czarist jewels. Soon business turns to pleasure as she discovers the special magic of Paris and succumbs to the charms of a suave Frenchman named Leon D’Algout (Melvyn Douglas).

results.title: Ningla A-Na
results.brief_description: For the first time in 200 years of white domination, Aboriginal people confronted the government at a national level – and in the words of poet, author and campaigner for Indigenous land rights Roberta “Bobbi” Sykes, achieved “a political victory”. Framed within an international human rights context, ‘Ningla A-Na’ (Hungry for Land) uses television news coverage of the clash between protesters and police at the Aboriginal Tent Embassy in 1972 to great effect, showing how the event was portrayed both nationally and internationally. Interviews with Dr Fred Hollows, Shirley Smith (Mum Shirl), Bob Maza, Carol Johnson and Paul Coe contextualise the issues advocated by the Black movement. This film gives voice to the most talented and effective Indigenous activists in the country at the time. Source: Australian Screen

results.title: Nine queens = Nueve Reinas
results.creator_credit: Fabian Belinsky, Pablo Bossi and Patagonik Film Group
results.brief_description: Impressive debut from Argentinean filmmaker Fabian Belinsky, sees two con-artists link up, despite their mutual mistrust and misgivings, in order to pull off increasingly complex, daring and lucrative scams. This culminates in a scheme to sell a valuable sheet of stamps, the Nine Queens of the title, to a wealthy businessman. To do this the pair must continuously re-invent the set-up and its execution. Reminiscent of the work of David Mamet, Belinsky keeps the audience delightfully bewildered by the state of play as the narrative threads gradually unravel. An amusing and clever addition to the caper genre.

results.title: My father is a hero
results.creator_credit: Corey Yuen, Tiffany Chin, Wong Jing and Jing Tung Productions
results.brief_description: An undercover policeman from Mainland China (Jet Li) is assigned the dangerous task of infiltrating a criminal organisation in Hong Kong. Years of undercover work and keeping his occupation concealed from his disease-stricken wife and young son have shattered his family life. When a female Hong Kong detective finds out about his double identity, she endeavors to bring his son to Hong Kong, but in doing so blows the policeman’s cover, leaving him fighting for both his own and his son’s lives. While Jet Li was already famous for his roles in historical martial arts films such as the ‘Once Upon a Time’ and ‘Fong Sai Yuk’ series, this was his first part in a contemporary action film. This film established his reputation in this genre and further enhanced his working relationship with action director master Corey Yuen-Kwai. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: My father's camera
results.creator_credit: Karen Shopsowitz, Silva Basmajian and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This documentary examines home movies and their unique place in popular culture. Shopsowitz, whose father was a keen amateur filmmaker, traces the history of home movies and camera equipment manufactured for home use from the 1920’s, through to the amateur explosion of the thirties, forties and beyond. Footage shot by her father and other filmmakers is interspersed with interviews with scholars, collectors and filmmakers, to convey not only the personal worth of home movies but their cultural value as historical documents that reflect social mores and values.

results.title: Just like you
results.creator_credit: Fran Haarsma, Fran Haarsma Productions and Ideas That Work
results.brief_description: Just like you is a comprehensive guide for people who are unsure of how to act around people with disabilities. The program answers questions such as, can you say “look” to a person who is blind? Do you offer to push someone in a wheelchair? Presented by people with disabilities, we are shown the preferred etiquette that can make interaction easier for both parties.

results.title: Just for me
results.creator_credit: Lois Tupper, Dee Simpson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Just for Me documents three women’s experiences with fitness and sport: that of a homemaker with children, an office worker who has just moved to the city, and a married school teacher. The film looks at the women before they participate in a sport, as well as during and after the experience.
